alert.note: Alert for Southern Gila County, Tonto National Forest Foothills (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued May 06 at 12:49PM MST until May 08 at 8:00PM MST by NWS Phoenix
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 10 AM TO 8 PM MST SUNDAY FOR STRONG WINDS, LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY AND VERY HIGH FIRE DANGER FOR SOUTHERN GILA COUNTY... The National Weather Service in Phoenix has issued a Red Flag Warning for strong winds, low relative humidity and very high fire danger, which is in effect from 10 AM to 8 PM MST Sunday. The Fire Weather Watch is no longer in effect. * AFFECTED AREA...Southern Gila County/Tonto National Forest Foothills. * TIMING...Sunday morning through Sunday evening. * WINDS...Southwest 10 to 20 mph with gusts up to 35 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...As low as 10 percent. * IMPACTS...Fuels are dry and fire danger is very high. These conditions combined with low relative humidity and strong winds will lead to widespread hazardous fire weather conditions. * IMPACTS...Fuels are very dry and fire danger is very high. These conditions combined with low relative humidity and strong winds will lead to widespread hazardous fire weather conditions.
info.instruction: Please advise the appropriate officials and fire crews in the field of this red flag warning.

area.areaDesc: Southern Gila County, Tonto National Forest Foothills
